title: Bury receive boost as MP holds positive talks with FA over the club entering National League
text:
Bury FC have finally received some positive news, after local MP James Frith held constructive talks with the FA over the club entering the National League next season.

It is up to the FA's discretion where Bury play in the future, following the club's expulsion from the English Football League over its financial difficulties.

Yet the early indication is that Frith and his fellow members of the Bury FC Rescue Board will get their wish of being accepted into the fifth or sixth tier of English football.

Bury FC have finally received some positive news, after local MP James Frith held positive talks

Following Friday's meeting with members of the FA Board, Frith, the MP for Bury North, said: 'I'm delighted to have the backing of the FA to get Bury FC into the National League system and I'll be working with them and all stakeholders to make this happen at the earliest opportunity.'

Meanwhile, Andy Ambler, the FA's director of professional game relations, said: 'We held a positive meeting with James Frith today and look forward to working together.'

HMRC's winding up petition against Bury is due to be heard next week.
description: Bury FC have finally received some positive news, after local MP James Frith held constructive talks with the FA over the club entering the National League next season.
